Forty years ago today, Sally Ride launched into history as the first U.S. woman to go to space. An astronaut, physicist, and educator, she inspired generations of women and girls to pursue careers in science and technology. https://go.nasa.gov/3NzVmHU

Happy Father’s Day, Sun 

Our Sun may be old, large, and full of gas, but it also provides our solar system with energy and light, without which life as we know it would not exist. Shout out a father figure who gives you energy:

Every December, the Geminids light up the night sky in one of the biggest meteor showers of the year.

As our Parker Solar Probe swoops around the Sun—closer than any spacecraft in history—it's helping uncover how these shooting stars came into existence: https://go.nasa.gov/3NfS0se

Why is Venus so hot?

The planet’s thick CO2-filled atmosphere is great at trapping heat. This creates a runaway greenhouse effect that makes Venus roughly 700°F (389°C) hotter than it would be otherwise. 
@NASAJPL
's Dr. Amy Hofmann gives us the details: https://go.nasa.gov/42FxR4v

Live Now 

Join us for a "guided tour" of our "Eyes on Asteroids" real-time visualization app. Learn how to use the tool and explore the 28,000 known asteroids and comets in our cosmic neighborhood.

Liftoff! Two small satellites are on the way to join two already in orbit for our TROPICS mission. TROPICS will provide near-hourly data that could improve forecasts of tropical cyclones and severe weather.

#Ax2 is on its way to space!

The all-private astronaut mission lifted off from 
@NASAKennedy
 at 5:37pm ET (2137 UTC).
#Ax2 has arrived! The @SpaceX Dragon crew ship with four private astronauts from @Axiom_Space docked to the station at 9:12am ET today. They will enter the orbital outpost soon live on @NASA TV.
NOW: Watch the @Axiom_Space #Ax2 astronauts arrive at the @Space_Station. The @SpaceX Dragon is set to dock at around 9:16am ET (1316 UTC).
LIVE: Mission experts recap the launch of #Ax2, @Axiom_Space's second all-private mission to the @Space_Station.

#Ax2's @SpaceX Dragon Freedom spacecraft has separated from its rocket—the Axiom Mission 2 crew is now on course for the @Space_Station.

Tune in for docking coverage (here and on NASA TV) starting at 7:30am ET (1130 UTC) on Monday, May 22.

#Ax2 is on its way to space!

The all-private astronaut mission lifted off from @NASAKennedy at 5:37pm ET (2137 UTC).

Did you catch our latest @NASAArtemis Moon Minute in the Axiom-2 launch broadcast?

@NASA and @Axiom_Space are working to prepare the suits that astronauts will wear when they land on the Moon for Artemis III.

LIVE: Four private astronauts are heading to the @Space_Station for scientific research, student outreach and commercial activities on @Axiom_Space's #Ax2 mission.

Watch with NASA, Axiom Space, and @SpaceX—liftoff is scheduled for 5:37pm ET (2137 UTC).

On a power trip. 

After a 10-month voyage attached to the @Space_Station, a power cell material survives and thrives. The efficient light-absorbing material may play a valuable role in powering long-duration space missions: https://go.nasa.gov/3MKK4jH
